before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"dlvsq","text":"Tissue Handling ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao080","text":"Biopsied tissues are stored at 4°C in vials containing a nutrient-rich media to keep the cells alive and a mixture of antibiotics to prevent bacterial growth. If vials with media are not readily available, biopsies can be placed in a tube containing sterile saline and kept at 4°C. All samples must be collected under aseptic conditions to avoid contamination. Using sterile tweezers, scalpels, and scissors, as well as cleaning the sampling site with alcohol or surgical scrub (e.g. chlorhexidine) will decrease the chances of contamination. Collect as many samples as possible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45bjf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14gru","text":"Cold Storage","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1igem","text":"Avoiding temperature fluctuations is very important for preserving the tissue samples. Use ice packs for transport of specimens from the field and ensure refrigeration is available immediately after returning from the field site. Do not use wet ice or other commercial therapeutic packs. Chill ice packs in the freezer the night before collection. Frozen ice packs will remain cold in an insulated container for up to 24 hours. If the field site is more than 24 hours from refrigeration, plan to bring a portable electric refrigerator.  Vials containing tissue should not have direct contact with the ice packs. Never freeze tissue biopsies before shipping to a biobanking facility.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":612,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2ng7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4trv8","text":"Shipping","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"906ap","text":"Samples must be shipped to a biobanking laboratory via overnight express. You must use an insulated container and ice packs to maintain a temperature between 4-8°C. Considering that samples may be in queue at the receiving facility for a period of time before they are processed, ship your samples as soon as possible. Shipment Monday through Wednesday will guarantee arrival at the receiving facility before the weekend. Do not ship samples on Friday. Most facilities will not be available to receive shipments on weekends. If samples are collected Thursday through Sunday, samples must be stored in the fridge until Monday. Consult with the receiving facility for any questions regarding shipping timelines before sending samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":280,"length":37},{"style":"bold","offset":422,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"68c2b","text":"Skin biopsies can be taken when animals are immobilized for veterinary exams, radio-collaring, relocation, capture and release for captive breeding, and ear tagging. The collection of samples should be opportunistic and follow all applicable regulations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7i0lu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4f497","text":"Biopsies must be larger than 3mm3 to yield enough living fibroblasts cells for the eventual creation of cell lines. For large mammals, 5 or 6 mm biopsies are recommended. For very small mammals, 2 or 3 mm biopsies are recommended. Collect at least two biopsies per individual from different locations on the body.  Collecting two samples per individual increases the chances of successful biobanking in case one sample is not successful. Only for very small mammals should one sample per individual be collected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":231,"length":45},{"style":"sup","offset":32,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":231,"length":45}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nc6d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5kjju","text":"Biopsied tissues are stored in vials containing a nutrient-rich media to keep the cells alive and a mixture of antibiotics to prevent bacterial growth. Include only one biopsy sample per vial. If you are running low on materials, up to two biopsy can be including in one vial. DO NOT mix biopsies from different individuals in the same vial. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":165,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":183,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":277,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dt41d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p7ta","text":"For urgent questions regarding protocol steps or collection guidelines, please contact the Revive \u0026 Restore Biobanking Team at informedbiobanking@reviverestore.org ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"clbcv","text":"Pre-chill icepacks in the freezer the day before planning to collect and ship samples.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"al7ci","text":"Record all information indicated in the biopsy form, including a picture of the animal for identification and GPS location where the animal was found. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5d8bc","text":"For general sedation, anesthetize according to standard practices (refer to Handbook of Wildlife Chemical Immobilization by Terry Kreeger). For local anesthesia, use what is most appropriate for the species at hand. Avoid use of injection or topical lidocaine. Bupivacine is recommended. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":215,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":44}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F94587F0450511ED8E0FC5BF40B5F58B","url":"https://www.amazon.com/Handbook-Wildlife-Chemical-Immobilization-5th/dp/0692118411"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b0v5","text":"Shave sampling area with hair trimmer, removing as much hair as possible. Ear punches are most preferred for collection, but biopsies can also be collected from the neck, flank, or lower abdomen. Skip this shaving if the area (e.g. ear) is too small to trim.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cchbq","text":"Soak gauze with rubbing alcohol and rub shaved sampling area to thoroughly disinfect. Chlorhexidine may also be used in addition to alcohol to disinfect. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5k5a0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7hbe5","text":"Discard used gauze. Reserve some clean gauze for use later.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"disfu","text":"Remove the biopsy vials with media from the kit and have them readily available. There are different methods for obtaining skin biopsies. The table below indicates the recommend size and number of biopsies for small and large mammals. Select the biopsy size that is safest for your species: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3705m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qk2s","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fbaji","text":"Next, select the method below that is most appropriate for the species being handled:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0":["B"],"1":["_"],"2":["2"],"A_1":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"A_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"B_1":{"className":" "},"B_2":{"className":"_dt-h-center"},"C_1":{"className":" "},"C_2":{"className":" "}},"colTitles":[" ","Biopsy size","No. biopsies PER individual"],"colWidths":["130","151","276"],"data":[["Small Mammals","2, 3, or 4 mm","1 or more"],["Large Mammals","4, 5, or 6  mm","2 or more"]],"guid":"D1EA9A907BDF11ED8D474D13D37F5013","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"dcon0","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":[]},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Small Mammals","2, 3, or 4 mm","1 or more"],["Large Mammals","4, 5, or 6  mm","2 or more"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}

cases.title: Skin biopsy tool
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5nh3f","text":"A 4mm biopsy tool is preferred. However, a 2 or 3 mm biopsy tool can be used for small mammals. A 4 mm or larger biopsy tool is ideal for large mammals. Collect at least 2 biopsy samples from different areas of the body per individual. For very small mammals, one sample per individual may be collected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":161,"length":25,"style":"bold"},{"offset":220,"length":14,"style":"bold"},{"offset":161,"length":25,"style":"italic"},{"offset":220,"length":14,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"504j4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i86s","text":"Remove biopsy tool from sterile packaging. Keep the sharp metal tip sterile by avoiding contact with non-sterile surfaces. With the biopsy tool perpendicular to the skin, gently press down onto the skin in the shaved area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56o2m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"47ebo","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"5dq14","text":"Use a gentle twisting motion in one direction with slight downward pressure to cut through all the layers of skin including epidermis, dermis, and the most superficial parts of the subcutaneous fat. Gently pull out the tool at a 45 degree angle, avoiding damage to the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":32,"length":13,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bccr1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16cdf","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8coem","text":"Use tweezers or a 25-gauge needle to gently grasp the biopsy and pull the sample up and out. Do not crush the sample with the tweezers. If it does not lift, do not tug to tear it off. Use a razor blade or sterile scissors to cut as low as possible at the underlying fat. Discard/replace instruments between individual animals. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3d0ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t4kp","text":" cases.title: Ear biopsy with ear punch tool or skin biopsy tool
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"312uv","text":"A 4mm punch is preferred. For large mammals, 5 mm punch or larger is recommended. For very small mammals, 2mm-3mm punch is preferred. However, ear punches are not recommended if the punch causes undue harm or requires removing more than half of the ear. Collect at least 2 biopsy samples per individual. For very small mammals, one sample per individual may be collected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":262,"length":25,"style":"bold"},{"offset":288,"length":14,"style":"bold"},{"offset":262,"length":25,"style":"italic"},{"offset":288,"length":14,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62rq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19o6d","text":"1. Use either an ear punch tool (for large mammals) or skin biopsy tool (for small mammals). Remove tool from packaging and keep the sharp metal tip sterile by avoiding contact with non-sterile surfaces. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":17,"length":15,"style":"bold"},{"offset":55,"length":4,"style":"bold"},{"offset":60,"length":11,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cs9ar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1u5ls","text":"2. Place the ear punch away from the edge of the ear, avoiding veins. Place the tool perpendicular to the skin and gently press down onto the skin in the shaved area. For skin biopsy tool only: Use a gentle twisting motion in one direction with slight downward pressure to cut through the ear. Gently pull out the tool, avoiding damage to the sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":167,"length":27,"style":"italic"},{"offset":226,"length":13,"style":"UNDERLINE"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fhbla","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3p5e","text":"3. Do not use excessive force to punch the ear. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6qtqf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f096j","text":"Below is an example of how to use an ear punch tool*: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0ag","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":{}},{"key":"6hsip","text":"Video credit: TransOva Genetics, 2021","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":37,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"27pit","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gfm6","text":"*Note: This video is used only to demonstrate the use of the ear punch tool.  Reagents and materials included in TransOva's commercial kit may not be suitable for cryopreservation or preserving tissues for cell culture downstream. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":231,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"video","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"guid":"27F8A7B0348711ED8EC275A2400BBDCF","id":293317,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/i8qfbuzfp.mp4","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/i8qgbuzfp.jpg","original_name":"TransOvaEarPunch.mp4","mime":"video/mp4","shadow":false,"is_video":true,"width":0,"height":0,"legend":"","nestedSelector":null}}}}

cases.title: Sterile scalpel
cases.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3m70m","text":"Tissues can be taken from the neck, flank, or lower abdomen. For large mammals, 5 mm3 biopsies or larger are recommended. For small mammals, 2, 3, or 4 mm3 biopsies are recommended. Collect at least 2 biopsy samples from different areas of the body per individual. For very small mammals, one sample per individual may be collected. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":84,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":154,"length":1,"style":"sup"},{"offset":190,"length":25,"style":"bold"},{"offset":249,"length":14,"style":"bold"},{"offset":190,"length":25,"style":"italic"},{"offset":249,"length":14,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20q25","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qpdc","text":"Using sterile tweezers and scalpel, grasp a piece of skin from the center of the shaved area and cut off a full thickness of dermis about the size of a pea. Discard/replace instruments between individual animals. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Skin Biopsy Protocol (Mammals): Non-lethal Sampling
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"20u3d","text":"Steps for personal safety must be considered before going into the field. Some wildlife diseases are transmissible to humans. Refer to your agency’s health and safety guidelines for personal protective equipment (PPE). At a minimum, field personnel should wear disposable gloves and a fresh pair should be used between handling different specimens to avoid cross contamination. Sampling instruments and equipment should be thoroughly cleaned and disinfected or disposed of after use.
